dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CAMERA LOOKS DOWN ON three levels of escalators  transporting a smattering of Southwestern shoppers -- som in cowboy hats.

dialogues.speaker: AS CREDITS ROLL
dialogues.text: A SERIES OF ANGLES of shoppers being conveyed up and down

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful vista -- cacti and sage dot the landscape as rises to mountains in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: END CREDITS
dialogues.text: THE CAMERA PANS revealing an island of modern culture --  malls and more malls, parking lots, and fast food franchi

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN TITLE
dialogues.text: A brown Pinto pulls out of a parking lot and into rush ho traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH WALKER is driving. She looks younger, but she's twen eight. She has a strong face and flashing intelligent eye She's wearing a WAITRESS UNIFORM from Friendly's. She's d in thought. Beth pulls up to stoplight and stops. SOUND: A gentle toot of car horn. Beth looks up, startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SID, a pleasant looking twenty-four year old, is in a pic up truck next to her. He smiles and points up toward the  traffic light.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: She looks up toward the traffic light.

dialogues.speaker: TRAFFIC LIGHTS
dialogues.text: They're red except for one with a lit green arrow.

dialogues.speaker: BETH AND SID
dialogues.text: She pantomimes that she's in the wrong lane and wants to straight. Sid pantomimes that he'll let her cut in front of him. SOUND: Horns honk impatiently.

dialogues.speaker: THE INTERSECTION
dialogues.text: Beth pulls away in front of the pick-up truck. The HONKIN continues. Sid looks back at the honking car, cheerfully  waves to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tiny well-kept Spanish style home in lower middle class residential section.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's neat and smartly furnished -- discount Swedish moder framed deco posters, some nice plants. The only problem i it seems a little more like a well-designed waiting room  than a home. There's an empty ice bucket, several empty liquor bottles and a swinging metal ball thingabobby on a chrome and gla coffee table in front of leather sofa. CAROL AND NICK are curled up together on the sofa, drinks hand. They're both in their late twenties. Carol's dressed in t casually stylish clothes worn by women who work in shoppi mall boutiques. Nick's clothes are frumpled, a knit tie loose around his  neck. They've achieved a state of contemplative drunkenne Carol sips her drink. Nick sips his drink. Carol sips her drink. Nick brings his glass to his lips, hesitates...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flatly) We're moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enunciating) We're going to move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In two days?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol shakes her head in weary disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (covering her hurt) Thanks for the news...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knocks back her drink. Nick broods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't known for long. I just  decided. (ruminating) What do I need that makes me make  these decisions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol stares at him. He knocks back his drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pours herself another drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does Beth say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops at an intersection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever makes me happy. That's what  she says...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Headlights flash from behind her. She turns and looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid's smiling from his truck right behind her. He flashes his lights again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth looks up in the rearview mirror, amused.

dialogues.speaker: REARVIEW MIRROR
dialogues.text: Sid turns off, disappearing into the night.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Surprised to find herself vaguely disappointed, she drive on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's small, prefab, and tidy. It has a counter with shutt that open onto the living room. Nick is kneeling, going  through bottles in a cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (w/ drunken desperation) I know this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick stands, with an almost empty bottle of Johnny Walker Red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what happens here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pours himself a drink. Carol shuts the cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what's going to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick opens a cabinet under the sink and tosses the empty  bottle in the trash. He begins to pace. Carol shuts the  cabinet and follows him with her gaze. As Nick speaks, he gestures grandly with his drink, liquo splashing unnoticed over the sides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bursting with  frustration) The same job, same scenery, same  people... I've been in this town for  years... Years!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flatly) Three years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in despair) Oh, Carol...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops and slugs back his drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forever -- it seems forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth pulls up to a stoplight, her face blank with thought She's suddenly lit by the flash of headlights going on an off. She looks up and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid's pick-up truck is facing her across the intersection It slowly pulls up beside her and stops. He smiles and gives a little wave of his hand. Without knowing why, she smiles and waves back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sweetly but firmly) Good-bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She drives away. Sid stares after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol lifts the end metal ball on the thingabobby and rel it, starting the chain reaction. She stares at it clackin back and forth as she speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long a drive is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick paces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fourteen hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a car? It's a fuckin' nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol stops the metal ball. She releases two balls, start a new chain reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (griping) And there's no radio in Utah. It's  all religious programs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get saved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick slumps on the sofa beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flatly) No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Think about this. You take a  detour and go through Vegas -- you  and Beth stop, see a show, have a  nice romantic dinner -- play the  slots, get the free drinks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Too much money. The show. The meal.  The slots. Then the hotel -- that's  another hundred down the toilet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Carol speaks she pokes at Nick. He fends off her blows By the end of her speech she is on top of him mock-strang him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jabbing Nick) No, you skip the hotel. It's night,  the highway's empty -- you can make  good time. You start speeding. You  get stopped in Utah by the cops --  you flunk the breathalizer, they  haul you in. The judge is Mormon --  you get fifteen years, you go to  prison, but at least your life has  taken a direction!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Carol collapse into laughter. The front door ope

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling in) I'm here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth steps in. Carol quickly lets go of Nick's neck and g off him.

dialogues.speaker: NICK AND CAROL
dialogues.text: Embarrassed, they both smile self-consciously. There's an awkward instant followed by too much cheerfuln

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chipper) Hi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: stands in the doorway, awkwardly conscious of having  interrupted something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (w/ forced cheer) Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Beth are standing in the lawn, lit by the glow o the porch lamp. Both sides of the street are lined with nearly identical  tiny faux Spanish houses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: G'night.

dialogues.speaker: THE FRONT DOORWAY
dialogues.text: Carol waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: G'night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Pizza Hut, tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. (to Beth) I've got the short shift -- you want  me to come over, help pack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great... I'm really sorry we didn't  tell you sooner. He just decided.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: smiles to herself, a trace of sadness in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: NICK AND BETH
dialogues.text: She starts to walk across the lawn. She stops and stares Nick, who's staring out into the night, oblivious to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tired. I'm going to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't got a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks up to her and past her -- when she doesn't fall  into step, he stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You agreed to try Billings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. (in Nick's words) Billings, Montana. City of the future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah and I read that a while ago --  so the future's probably already  there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles and shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensively) It's not like you're leaving anything  behind. A good job or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just some friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his arms around her waist from behind, and nestle her against his body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll make new friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. (after a beat) I'm not eight years old. I know I'll  make new friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls away from him and starts walking to the house n door. He falls into step with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncomfortably) I, umm... I... It embarrasses me.  When you talk about something with  Carol that happened before me. She's  my best friend. It embarrasses me  that you used to live with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we're moving. She won't be your  best friend anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They arrive at their front door. Beth takes out her keys. Nick stops her hand and kisses her. She kisses him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Living with someone isn't such a big  deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods and looks to the lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway... I live with you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth looks to Nick. He stares out at the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coffee-maker clock hits nine o'clock. The coffee make clicks on with a rattle. Steam starts to spew out. The coffee-maker makes horrible gurgling sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kitchen is small and a little grimy, its furnishings  fatigued. Nick stares at the coffee-maker in disbelief. He's dresse in a dress shirt, untied necktie, and slacks. He's carryi a sportscoat with a Sears' employee name-tag attached.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Beth!... Beth!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth walks into the kitchen, wearing a robe and carrying paper. Nick points accusingly at the coffee maker as water pours down from around its top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's... it's raining!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It does that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She drops the paper on the kitchen table and gets a mug o the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since we got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (pouring herself a  cup) Lately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (throwing his jacket  on a chair) Shit. (agitated) What's wrong with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water comes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. (unplugging the coffee  maker) I hate this shit! It never kept the  coffee hot. And now this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He angrily wraps the cord around the coffee-maker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blowing on her coffee) It still works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (adamant) No. It doesn't. Water comes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sips her coffee. She flips open a box of Dunkin' Donu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could've gotten a new one. On my  discount. Now it's too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want a donut?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exasperated) No. I want an appliance that works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth shrugs and takes a donut out of the box. She leans  against the counter, eating the donut. Nick walks past Beth and jams the coffee maker into the t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This coffee maker was junk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick pushes a button on the blender. It makes a horrible  GRINDING WHINE. He unplugs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This blender's junk. Our t.v. is  junk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He jams the blender into the trash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why we're even bothering  to pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through a mouthful  of donut) You got me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The t.v. gets no channels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's fifteen inch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) I can't believe we don't have a big  t.v.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't watch much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But at our age...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at each other. Nick picks the almost full pint bottle of scotch off the counter and puts it in his jacke pocket. Beth takes another donut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you take one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (offhandedly) Not a donut. A t.v.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a t.v.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your last day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a bonus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth is holding a donut and her coffee mug. Nick tosses h jacket into the front seat of his old sedan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say do it. (after a beat) Sears can afford to give you a bonus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe when I get my check today,  there'll be a bonus in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (evenly) Nick. They fired you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flatly) There's no bonus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... That's true. (shaking his head) And I sold a lot of teevees for  them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth sips her coffee, waiting for Nick to decide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly) You should take a t.v.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should go. (sarcastically) Don't wanna be late on my last day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses Beth, surprising her. He presses against her. H takes the donut from her hand and takes a bite. Beth kisses Nick, his mouth still full of donut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmmm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her fully, then breaks the kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About hundred cars dot the vast parking lot. Nick swings into a parking spot and gets out of the car. tosses his jacket on the roof and crouches, tieing his ne using the car's outside mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You livin' in your car or what?

dialogues.speaker: IN THE MIRROR
dialogues.text: CHIP, a big redheaded guy in his late thirties, wearing a jacket and tie, is grinning at the crouched Nick. Nick's  reflection grins back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just waiting for the last second to  put on the noose. (tightening the tie) So Chip -- what's new?

dialogues.speaker: NICK AND CHIP
dialogues.text: Nick straightens up and grabs his jacket. They start walk toward the mall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing much. (broaching the subject) I heard you're leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'm outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They approach the employees entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what they think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was gonna quit anyway -- this way  I get unemployment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... recession insurance... (Chip enters) This way I'm not stuck waiting around  for the lay-offs to start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick follows Chip in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a hint of panic) Lay-offs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door shuts behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front page of the Phoenix Sun-Times -- the headline r "Misery Index Soars". Beth's hand comes INTO FRAME and crumples the page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth stuffs the paper in a glass and wraps the glass in  another piece. She's sitting on the floor, surrounded by  dishes, newspaper, and cardboard liquor boxes. She adds t wrapped glass to a box. She hears the SOUND of a CAR DOOR SLAMMING, looks up, the returns to her packing. She reaches behind herself into t trash, pulls out the blender, and begins to wrap it. At the SOUND of the FRONT DOOR opening, followed by a cur METALLIC CLUNKING, she stands and hurries through the swi door to the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The living room is sparsely furnished -- a sofa, a coffee table, a bookcase cluttered with a handful of paperbooks, couple of boardgames, a dying cactus, etc. A crappy old  fifteen inch t.v. on a t.v. tray. WE SEE this for a momen before... A paint-splattered cloth is unfurled FILLING THE SCREEN. It gently floats down, revealing a PAINTER and his shoppi cart overloaded with supplies. He's dressed in paint- splattered clothes. A paint-splattered Red Sox cap is pul low over his eyes, obscuring his face. Beth stares in disbelief. Without seeing her, the painter backs up, his attention focused on spreading the dropclot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not looking up) The painter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (agitated) What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Painting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The painter looks up from the drop-cloth, ready to deal w this obstacle. He freezes. His face lights up. It's Sid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (extremely pleased) Well, good morning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recognizing him) You...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (extending a hand) Sid. Nice to see you again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth stares in agitated disbelief. With his untaken extended hand, he pulls a long strip of  masking tape from a roll around his wrist, masking one si of the door frame from top to bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Realty office likes a fresh coat  between tenants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointedly) We're still here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands on his tiptoes and puts a strip of masking tape the top edge of the doorframe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've done this house before. (admiringly) I did a nice job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He masks the remaining side of the door frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you come back tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow's Sunday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The new people move in on Sunday. (conversationally) Where are you moving to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wearily) Billings, Montana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid moves to a window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can't be worse than Enfield,  Arizona.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid pulls a strip of tape off the roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) I've lived in Enfield my whole life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds out the end of the masking tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you hold this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth takes it. He walks backwards, easing a long strip of tape off the roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I use this to mask. Have you ever  used masking tape to mask?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tears the tape off the roll and sticks it to the top o the baseboard in one corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I haven't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crouched, he waddles across the room toward Beth, applyin the masking tape to the baseboard. He gets to Beth, stand up, takes the tape off her fingers, and presses it into p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A house like this, it's real easy.  Hardly needs a paint job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can skip it. I won't tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It needs a fresh coat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands her the end of the tape again and begins another baseboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a little color.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (naturally curious) What color is it gonna be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off-white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes along the floor pressing the masking tape to the  baseboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's already off-white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's white. It's just dirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth looks at the walls. He's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now if it was my house, I would choose  a color...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth kneels down, holding the tape, as he arrives at her of the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would not choose off-white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth holds out the tape. They are kneeling next to each o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you choose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The color of your eyes. (pause, without looking) Hazel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth stares at Sid. Sid looks to Beth. Smiling, he takes tape from her fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An oasis in the center of a packed mall parking lot. Caro hurries toward the front entrance in a snappy skirt and b combo, a Bullock's name tag attached to her lapel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick is sitting at a booth, a beer in front of him, lost thought. Carol arrives, drops a gift-wrapped box on the table, and scoots into the booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry I'm late, the new girl's a  moron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking to the present) What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going away present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick takes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He quickly unwraps it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (happily) A map!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you might need it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unfolding it) I do! I had a map -- I lost it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spreads the map out over the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (organized) Let's highlight your route.

dialogues.speaker: A MAP
dialogues.text: of the Western half of the U.S.A. fills the FRAME. Carol' hand, holding a bright red felt-tip pen, ENTERS FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's Enfield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She circles it. Nick's finger ENTERS FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's Billings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol circles Billings. Nick's finger starts to trace the route. Carol's pen follows, marking the route. Halfway to Billin Nick's finger abruptly stops. Carol stops the pen at the  same point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this -- right there -- that's  the town I was born in.

dialogues.speaker: NICK AND CAROL
dialogues.text: He looks to her for a reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emphatically) Where I grew up. Where my parent's  live... Isn't that a coincidence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visit them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) Oh... no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to be driving by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... (shaking his head) They're not near the interstate. (sort of chagrined) I haven't even called them in years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might as well visit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (adamantly) No. (shrugging) I wouldn't know them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick starts to fold the map -- very unsuccessfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick hands her the map. She deftly folds it in one motion and hands it back to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans over the table and kisses her. She stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm starved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two of the walls gleam with fresh paint. Sid is painting with long-handled roller. Beth, enters, hesitates, and then -- consciously ignoring him -- walks by with a packed box and adds it to the stac by the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm lucky I don't have to kill them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not a line she was  expecting) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they were dark, I'd have to put a  layer of kill down first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth starts back to the kitchen. Sid and THE CAMERA FOLLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the dark paint wouldn't shine  through the off-white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dishes are mostly packed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks up two empty liquor boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill's an oil based paint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth carries the boxes out of the kitchen -- Sid and THE  CAMERA FOLLOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth walks right on through followed by the talking Sid a THE CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It covers the old paint so that you'd  never know it was there, but it gives  off fumes when it's drying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth goes into the small hallway, Sid and THE CAMERA FOLL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth walks toward the bedroom, Sid right behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noxious fumes. They would find us on  the floor unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter the bedroom, THE CAMERA FOLLOWING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a queen-sized bed, a bureau, a mirror, and a clos Beth takes the boxes to the closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid sits on the bed, checking it's firmness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "they" that find people...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interjecting) Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flatly) Nick. (after a beat) The man I live with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) I guess he'd be the "they".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'd find us. And he'd be surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid gets off the bed and with a grin, gingerly pats out t wrinkles he's made in the bed spread.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Carol are walking away from the Pizza Hut, acros huge parking lot, toward a large mall. Cars circle past t searching for close spots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doggedly) It was the drive that killed us. San  Antonio to Seattle is just too many  hours in a car. If we'd have flown,  we would've made it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking her head) No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things were all right in bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the rest of the time they were...  awful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hurt) Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flatly) Nick. We couldn't stand each other.  We stopped in Enfield and just stayed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Why didn't you go on to Seattle? It  was your car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol stops. On her face, the answer to his question is c she was stuck on Nick then and she's still stuck on him n But she'd never let him know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dryly) Big trees scare me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts walking. Nick hurries up beside her. They walk side by side for a few paces before the shotdown Nick com up with a new ploy to win favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (casually) I'm thinking about stealing a t.v.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth's taking extra sheets and towels from the linen clos and packing them in liquor boxes. Sid enters from the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cheerfully) I'm done in there. I won't paint the  ceiling 'til you've moved the  furniture out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think we're going to take  much of the furniture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's ugly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kind of like the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a sofa bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to take it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flatly) It weighs two thousand pounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The furniture is kind of ugly, but the walls look great. whole room seems brighter, almost magically more cheerful Sid runs into the room and flops onto the sofa. He settle in and sighs contentedly. The front door BURSTS open. Sid leaps up. Carol races into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) Nick's gonna steal a t.v.!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees Sid and freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The painter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth hurries into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excitedly) He's really gonna do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol glances pointedly at Sid then returns her attention Beth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (conspiratorilly) We've got to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (piping in) About the crime?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharply) There's no crime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick's gonna steal a t.v.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's just an expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never heard that expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (witheringly) It's making the rounds. College  students use it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Beth) Where's he stealing it from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) You want him to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows. He doesn't care. (to Sid) Do you care?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enthusiastically) I'm interested. Crime's interesting.  I read the papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a crime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's justice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poetic justice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They fired him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deducing) He's got motive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exasperated) Who is this guy?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The painter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (helpfully) Sid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds out a hand to shake. Carol stares at his outstre hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (point blank) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol takes Beth by the arm and leads her away from Sid. stares back over her shoulder at Sid. Taking the hint, he begins to stir a can of paint, assumi an air of indifference. Carol turns her attention back to Beth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (purposefully) He needs you at the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tinged w/ apprehension) He needs me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick is standing next to RORY, a precocious eight year ol boy who's staring at a soap opera on a big screen t.v. As Nick and Rory talk, the soap ACTOR and ACTRESS passionate embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lookin' or buyin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lookin'. I hate television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. What do you like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Movies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laying it out) You see... you go to a movie, you're  there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rory listens attentively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You watch t.v., you're thirteen places  at once. As many channels as you  get, that's as many places as you  are. You get cable? You're forty  places at once. You get a satellite  dish?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're all over the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the BACKGROUND, on the big screen t.v., the soap actre breaks the embrace and points a gun at the actor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soap actress shoots the actor. He stares at her in  overacting disbelief and slumps to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called freedom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol watches as Sid whistles cheerfully, ripping the lon strips of masking tape off the trim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (w/ attitude) This is what you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I also mow lawns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is your career?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Painting. I'm an inside person. (confidentially) Mowing grass is seasonal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dryly) That is true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid wads the tape into a big ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disarmingly) You've got a nice tan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not disarmed) I work on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid shoots the tape ball into his shopping cart of suppli

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to get stoned?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol thinks for a moment. It's been a long time and she' not crazy about him being there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid takes a joint out of his shirt pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This kind of painting -- for people  I won't know -- it's boring. (lighting the joint) It's not very good. It's homegrown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a drag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it'll get you fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands the joint to Carol.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: takes a drag on the joint like an old pro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll take you someplace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol chokes back wheezes and then explodes in a coughing fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and MAJOR JENKINS, a uniformed military man in his l forties, are standing in front of a wall of silent color  televisions. On the t.v.s a nearly identical pairs of LOC ANCHORS smile their way through the news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you thought about American?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I own an American set. I'm very  satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want Japanese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick put his arm around the man's shoulder and guides him toward a display case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the thing is, a hundred and fifty  dollars gets you very little in the  way of Japanese technology.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop at the case. Nick points.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would get you that t.v.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tiny two inch Casio television playing "Gilligan's Isla

dialogues.speaker: NICK AND JENKINS
dialogues.text: Nick looks to see the Jenkin's reaction. Jenkins stares  dumbfounded at the tiny t.v. He looks to Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's for my parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your parents?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. They live with me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth enters the FRAME. Nick doesn't see her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and they want Japanese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick stifles a strange urge to giggle. Beth tries to subt get Nick's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (controlling the  giggles) No... I, uh, just never think of  adults as having parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flatly) They do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (agreeably) I know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth fake coughs to get his attention. Nick sees her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm an adult, I have parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick turns to Beth with a burst of salesman cheer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Miss, I've got your receipt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth approaches them, still not sure what Nick's up to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (acting cheerful) Oh... great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick holds out the receipt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all you need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth takes the receipt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled, but playing  along) Thanks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (personably) Now you just take this receipt out,  give it to the guys at the loading  dock and they'll give you your brand  new beautiful television set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thrown) I get the t.v...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cheerfully) Out back. They'll help load it in  your car and everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flatly) I get the t.v.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick turns his full attention to the man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think about American. They're mostly  Japanese parts anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth stares at Nick, amazed that he's managed to come up  with a plan that has her taking the television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, I just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting,  pleasantly) Miss... I'm helping this customer  here, perhaps you might... (firmly, a salesman's  put-off) You might want to see someone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointedly) You can't help me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat, then  w/ finality) Not really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth rides down on the escalator, the receipt clenched in her hand, surrounded by other shoppers, as a tinny Muzak  version of the "Theme from The Mary Tyler Moore Show" dro on in the background. Conflicting emotions cloud her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick sold a demo, wrote it up like a  new set, and gave me the receipt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Sid's jacknife ENTERS FRAME and zips through the packi tape, THE CAMERA PULLS BACK to reveal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is low, giving the room a golden glow. Sid and Beth are sitting on the sofa, the t.v. box on the floor in front of them. Sid opens the television box. Slowly, he pulls out the sh of bubbled packing plastic. He pops several of the bubble

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (savoring the bubble  plastic) Excellent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I should just leave it packed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon! You stole it. You gotta see  it! Hold the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth holds the box. Sid starts to lift out the television

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (urgently) Wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth looks to him, anxiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I heard the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth listens, nervously. Sid grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha ha ha. (an amused realization) You're stoned!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (innocently) Me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're being silly and you've got  bunny eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Embarrassed, Sid pulls Visine from a pocket and drips it his eyes as he speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a little stoned... not that  stoned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (after a beat) Carol's really stoned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got Carol stoned?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very stoned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't think she liked you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't. But she likes getting  stoned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) She does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing like drugs to create  a quick and shallow friendship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rubbing his hands) Let's look at the loot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid pulls the t.v. up and out of the box. He sits back on the sofa, the t.v. in his lap. The t.v. is spectacular -- huge, metallic, and ultra-mode

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very impressed) Jesus... you didn't fool around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (w/ mixed emotions) This is the nicest thing I've ever  owned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth stares at the television. Sid stares at Beth. She me his eyes, then looks quickly back to the television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick is driving. His face is beaded with sweat as he drag heavily on a cigarette. He pushes the buttons on his radi getting NEWS BROADCASTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in Canton, Ohio today, a man  opened fire in a mall, killing nine  and wounding seventeen others. Initial  reports indicate the young man was a  disgruntled employee...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick turns the radio off. He pulls the scotch bottle from his jacket and takes a sl He jerks his necktie loose and slips it over his head. He tosses it into the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: NICK'S SEDAN
dialogues.text: swerves into a vast mall parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the flow of traffic, WE SEE Nick standing at a  payphone on the outside wall of a Red Lobster Restaurant. Nick speaks urgently into the phone, punctuating his  conversation with edgy body language. Abruptly, he hangs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol hangs up a wallphone. She leans against the  refridgerator, her expression a controlled blank. She tur her head and looks out her kitchen window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through Nick and Beth's living room window, WE SEE Sid  struggling under the weight of the t.v. as Beth laughingl gestures where she wants it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth and Sid are kneeling on the floor in front of the t. Playing on the t.v. a rock video featuring girls, guitars and the endless highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a beautiful picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid takes the remote from Beth and turns the VOLUME UP ve loud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enthusiastically) Nice speakers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol enters through the front door, unseen by the mesmer t. v. viewers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (happily) Yeah! (w/ happy disbelief) Fuckin' Nick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid and Beth stare at the television, completely engrosse Carol stares at them for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over the din, dryly) Hi, kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Startled, Sid and Beth jump back. They look at each other and laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cheerfully) Come see!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth turns the VOLUME DOWN as Carol comes and looks at th t.v.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impressed) I should have had him steal me one,  too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can come over and watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol looks to Beth, a quizzical expression on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Beth, quietly) You're moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (w/ a tinge of sadness) Oh. Right. (to Carol) Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth turns off the t.v. There's a moment of awkward silen as they all stare at the blank screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breaking the silence,  pointedly) How's the painting going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) Too many distractions. I'll be at it  all night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have bad work habits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not when I'm actually working. (standing) I better get set up in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to his shopping cart of supplies. Carol and Beth  stare at the television. The television stares back at them, gleamingly modern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It makes teevee seem very futuristic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at the kitchen door) That's 'cause you're stoned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hardly stoned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks to Beth. Beth is grinning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mitigating) It was homegrown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (teasing) Want some Visine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flatly) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) It gets the red out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Visine comes flying INTO FRAME. Carol fumbles, then  catches it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dryly) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol tilts back her head and manuevers the Visine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Missed the eye, got the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth goes to her and takes the Visine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. (holding Carol's arm) Tilt your head back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop fidgeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts a drop in one eye. Carol flinches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol blinks and wipes a Visine tear off her cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding to the  kitchen, in a  conspiratorial whisper) He really wants to get in your pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) My pants are taken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tilts Carol's head back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you go for him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He likes you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth puts a drop in Carol's eye. Carol flinches and rubs eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish Nick would get back and help  with the packing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sighs, cheerfully exasperated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's probably getting drunk with the  stockboys... (after a beat) That's what he's probably doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol braces herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth... (pause, then w/  difficulty) Listen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare into each other's eyes. After a long moment Carol averts her eyes and looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (simply) He's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (badly shaken) Where'd he call from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said the highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth takes a deep breath, controlling her emotions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to be out of here Sunday.  That's tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can come to my place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) He's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth sinks onto the arm of the sofa to support herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently) He's an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth makes its way deeply into her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a half whisper) Fuckin' Nick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lightly traveled highway cuts a straight line through the desert. Nick's sedan pulls off into a service station with a gian teepee beside it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind is roaring, kicking up swirls of grey dust in th flourescent light of the service station. A TEENAGE NAVAJO boy is filling Nick's tank. Nick leans  against the car staring at the giant teepee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody lives in that, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gift shop. But it closed at seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cheerfully shrugging) I got no one to shop for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gust of wind sends dust into Nick's eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. (rubbing his eye) Fuckin' wind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sincerely) What does it mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High pressure field coming in --  should bring some nice weather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. The wind itself, you know what I  mean, you're an Indian...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (correcting him) I'm a Navajo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, so you're in tune with this  stuff...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking the pump) It's thirteen bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his train of thought  broken) Oh... right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick pulls a bill out of his wallet and holds it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's a twenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Navajo Teen takes the bill and takes a wad of bills f his pocket. Nick stares out at the moonlit desert and the mountains r in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what does the wind mean? Like as  an omen or something, you know -- (making his voice  mystical) -- a change is coming to the people. --  the spirit of freedom is walking the  land. (flatly) That kind of meaning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing him money) Fourteen, fifteen and five makes  twenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens Nick's car door for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind is. It's the wind like I'm  a Navajo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Navajo teen nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets in the car, his mood darkening, and pulls his doo shut with a slam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out the window) It would be better if meant something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Navajo teen shrugs. Nick starts the engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dimly lit room filled with raucous customers and lots o neon beer signs. Waitresses in red dresses tote pitchers brew to the thirsty throng. At the far end a band plays a foot-stompin' good time tune about a trucker on his way t see his woman. THE CAMERA MOVES through the crowd and discovers Carol an Beth sitting at a small table, an almost finished pitcher beer between them. They speak loudly to be heard over the din.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said he needs to be alone again.  Learn about himself. Make a fresh  start in a new town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth shakes her head then takes a sip of her beer -- it t bitter in her mouth and she puts her glass down in disgus

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) He's sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth stares at her beer. Carol puts a hand comfortingly o Beth's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said he would have called you,  but your phone's disconnected. 'Cause  you're moving. (after a beat) He's always been an asshole. (after a beat) You'll be all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently) I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big-haired WAITRESS approaches the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready for another?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol looks to Beth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... uh, no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Nick coming in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol throws the waitress a look that could kill. Beth ta a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick stares at the road ahead. He takes rapid drags on a  cigarette. The RADIO is barely audible over the ROAR of t WIND through the open windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (covered by static) "And he arose and came to his father,  but when he was still a great way  off, his father saw him and had  compassion, and ran and..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick turns the radio off. He fumbles the cigarette into the ashtray. He takes a pint of scotch from the front seat, uncaps it, takes a slug, takes another slug, recaps it, and drops it back on the seat. He stares at the road. He looks down to the front seat an finds the map. He splits his attention between the road a unfolding the map. The wind catches the map. The map billows up, covering his face. Losing control of car, Nick slaps it down. A car HORN blares. Nick jerks the car back into his lane, bats the map down  again, and pulls off to the side of the road. He stops the car and slams the shift into park. He opens his door a crack, turning on the dome light. He  smooths out the map on the dashboard. Billings and Enfield are marked with Carol's big red circ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick's finger traces from Enfield toward Billings along t route Carol highlighted with the red felt-tip. Halfway to Billings, the red line stops. Nick's finger stops.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: He stares at the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth comes in the front door. The sound of Sid whistling  comes softly from the kitchen. Beth stares at the t.v. for a moment then strides purpose toward the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid is standing on the counter masking the top sill of th kitchen window. There's half a donut hanging from his mou Beth comes through the swinging door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (forcefully) You've lived here your whole life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The half-donut falls from the startled Sid's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (increduously) You've never gone anywhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up the half-donut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travelling has no allure for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid climbs down and sits on the counter, dropping the hal donut back into the donut box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe through time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) That's not offered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I stay here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the simple truth) It's my home. I belong here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So was Sid -- but he realizes Beth doesn't believe it can as simple as that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father says if you stay in one  place long enough your luck knows  where to find you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wryly) Maybe that's my problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (carefully) Maybe it is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid holds out the box of donuts to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a donut and fiddles with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think your father knows the truth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a bartender. (smiling) He's lived here his whole life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has his luck found him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet. (after a beat) But it's probably very close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth smiles weakly. Abruptly, she drops her donut back in the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cautiously) Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (apologetically) Must be the paint fumes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens up the back door and steps out. Sid stares at t empty doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth stands in the moonlight, staring out at the stars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (contemplatively  dubious) You find what you want here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid steps out behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (simply) I found you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks out into the backyard. Sid follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (earnestly) We never met before last night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moonlight through the orange trees casts a magical ai about the backyard. Beth stops by a swingset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but we know each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth stiffens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks away from him. He watches her intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave it behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave what behind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unhappiness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused) That was a bad answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seriously) No. It was true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth stares at Sid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come hold me. (after a beat) Come hold me, and you'll be happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dryly) I'll find happiness. Right. In your  arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I won't. I have to find happiness  in myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. That's wrong. (going toward her) People tell you that, but it's wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns away from him. He stands behind her, close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've lived with people who have that  happiness from within. That happiness --  it's just them being pleased with  themselves. It's not enough. It's a  lonely thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and faces him. The moonlight casts a pale glow  over them. She stares in his eyes for a long moment. She steps back  from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're showing how young you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm not. I'm showing you a way.  You know that. And you know me. (after a beat) And I know you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks away from him, back to the swingset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid follows and takes her arms, turning her to face him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat,  defensively) I know you want to fuck me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls her very close. He lets go of her arms so she is standing against him, unrestrained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth stares at his face for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses him, suddenly, long and slow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) I know you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss, pulling each other tight. They lose their balance and stagger against the swingset, kissing passionately. Beth pulls back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (w/ fierce intensity) I know you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A canopy of stars hangs over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick is parked, staring at the house. The roadmap is on t seat beside him. He takes a drink from a half empty pint scotch. He screws the cap on and drops the bottle on the  map. He steps out of the car, unsteadily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick walks toward the door. He stops, stares at the door starts back for his car. He stops, shakes his head, and w quickly to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: FRONT PORCH
dialogues.text: Nick stands, staring at the door. He knocks. He waits  impatiently, then pounds on the door. On his third pound lights in the house suddenly go on.

dialogues.speaker: OVER NICK'S SHOULDER
dialogues.text: The door abruptly opens. MR. AUGUST, an eighty year old man, stands in the doorway HE wears pajamas, slippers, and a long robe. He is over s and a half feet tall.

dialogues.speaker: NICK AND MR. AUGUST
dialogues.text: Nick, startled, steps back. Mr. August stares at him. Nic composes himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. August stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me... I'm... I'm looking for  my parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. August calmly puts his hands over his ears, and slowl shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother, my father... they...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELIZABETH, a fifteen year old girl steps out from behind August. She seems very small next to Mr. August. He puts hand on her shoulder. She stares at Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncomfortably) Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exhaling in relief) Oh... good... (to the point) This is my house. I, uhh... mean  this is the house I grew up in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks past them into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding to Mr. August) This is his house now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds out a hand to Mr. August, who slowly shakes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's deaf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loudly) Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's stone deaf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. (uncomfortably) Yelling doesn't help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick breaks the handshake. Mr. August smiles at him. Nick looks to Elizabeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Nick, Nick Brennan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He waits for her to introduce herself. She doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know the Brennans?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lived here. They used to live  here. I used to live here with them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth stares at him. Nick tries his salesman charm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know an Elizabeth. (quietly) I call her Beth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bathed in moonlight, Sid and Beth make tender passionate  love. Sid has never wanted someone so much and Beth has never f so wanted. Beth clings to Sid as if she were afraid of being swept  away... and then she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chandelier casts a gently sparkling golden glow. The CAMERA TILTS down to reveal... Mr. August, Elizabeth and Nick, sitting at a large antiqu dining room table. Nick is eating a sandwich, an untouched glass of milk in  front of him. Mr. August and Elizabeth watch him, expecta Nick notices this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (swallowing) This is a good sandwich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (abruptly nodding  toward Mr. August) When did he move here? Would he know  where the people before him went?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He wouldn't remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. He doesn't remember anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. (taking a deep breath) He can't help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks around the familiar room, struck by the absurd of the situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with wry awareness) I've lost my parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick smiles weakly at Elizabeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (matter-or-factly) Did you lose them both at the same  time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that like a joke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then yes. I lost them both at the  same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lost mine one at a time. (after a beat) Last year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick realizes she's talking about death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. That's tragic. I should...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Six months apart. Body failures.  Separate body failures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really sorry. (standing) I should go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. August slowly stands as Elizabeth follows Nick toward the foyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First my father's heart kept starting  and stopping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) Attacks...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE FOYER
dialogues.text: Nick edges toward the door followed by Elizabeth and Mr.  August.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother and I were with him in the  hospital and he'd grab at us, he'd  grab my arms and hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's very sad... (after a beat, backing  toward the door) I've really gotta be going. I, uh...  thank you again for the sandwich.  Delicious...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right before my mother died, she  said -- "Elizabeth. You're adopted."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick stops in his tracks, his hand on the doorknob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you found your real parents?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Two are enough to lose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick stares at her -- the sad truth of her statement sink in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not alone. I have my Grandfather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks down. He is alone. He has no one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (opening the door) Listen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks into her eyes. Elizabeth suddenly grabs his arm. He stares at her, not knowing what to do. She holds his a tightly for a moment, then lets go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps back from Nick, against her grandfather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in explanation) He's stone deaf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick stares at Elizabeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he hurries out the door into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth is sitting up in bed, Sid leaning back against her, arms wrapped around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) I'd like to stay right here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to be out tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In this moment... Enjoying this  moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both lie perfectly still. A flicker of sadness cross Beth's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hushed) The moment's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) It can go on as long as we want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth leans him back, cradling him in her arms. She stares him, a quizzical expression on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (skeptically) Have you ever been in a relationship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (after a beat) I was married... but it wasn't really  a relationship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) You weren't married...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two years. Right out of high school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth ponders this for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I remind you of her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relieved) Thank God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid runs his hands over her body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have beautiful skin... her skin  was polka-dotted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freckled...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we were kids we called her  "Spot".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth looks to Sid. He's staring off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Was she ever found?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flicker of loss crosses his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not by me... (looking to Beth) I didn't go look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth stares at him, uncertainly. He leans up and gently t circles on Beth's skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wanted to meet someone new. I  asked her "why?" -- she said, "Because  he won't know me from before. Just  now. Just what I am now."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth looks to him, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
