dialogues.text: I knew her... on playgrounds... in  Sunday School... all those grades --  I knew her as she changed. But she  was still the same person. All the  times I knew her, she was still her. (after a beat) She can't get away from that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds Beth tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stay in one place, and all those  things that are you... are there.  She didn't understand that if you  leave, they're still there, in you --  but they stop being clear. You stop  knowing who you are, and what you  want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've stayed here and you know who  you are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves away from Beth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see the lawns I mow, houses I've  painted, faces I know... my parents...  And I'm constantly reminded of who I  am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you know what you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to be inside you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. (after a beat) Come here and put it inside me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I want to be able to put myself  inside of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doing this is as close as you get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth pulls Sid close, bringing him into her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds him tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come inside me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid arches away from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncertainly) I want... I want...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth pulls Sid back to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (w/ quiet urgency) Come inside me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hold each other tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks like hell -- his eyes red, his hair a mess. Th nearly empty scotch bottle is on the dashboard. The car windows are open, the roar of the wind competing  with the blasting radio. Nick suddenly jerks the wheel over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sedan screeches off the highway into the abandoned re area. It stops facing a battered phone booth -- the engine turn off but the headlines stay shining on the phone booth.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE SEDAN
dialogues.text: Nick turns off the radio. It is suddenly very quiet -- on the occasional lonely DRONE OF A TRUCK passing on the hig He takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick is standing in the phone booth, harshly lit by his  headlights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Could you give me the number for  information in Arizona?... Thank  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick dials with drunken concentration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Enfield. Carol, Carol, umm... (mortified) Carol... Carol Something... Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up. He hits himself in the head in angry disbeli He hurriedly dials zero and listens for a moment, despera summoning up all his salesman charm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Hello Janet, thank you for being my  operator. I hope you can help me, I  need to call my home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick listens impatiently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'll tell you my number, but  there's a problem. My phone's been  disconnected, not because of bills,  I mean we paid all our bills. We  were hardly ever even late. We were  very good customers, but we're moving,  so we had the phone disconnected.  But now I need to call... the woman  I live with. She's still there and  I've got to let her know where I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick listens, shaking his head emphatically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know any of the neighbors. I  know one, but I can't remember her  last name. (he listens, frustrated) No. No. No. You see you have to be  able to help me, this is not a prank,  it's my home phone, this is an  emergency. (he listens, then  urgently) Yes it can, it can be done. Someone  there can hook the phone back up.  It's not like a phone guy came to  our house to disconnect the phone,  nobody came to our house, someone  just flipped a switch somewhere,  somewhere there where you work, or  plugged something into a computer  and our phone stopped working! (he listens) They turned it off, they can turn it  back on! (he listens, starting  to panic) I know it's the week-end! I know!  Call them at home! They'll have a  computer at their house, they'll  have a phone thing to hook it up to  the real computer! That's how these  people live! They'll be glad to do  it!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick listens. Suddenly all his energy drains away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crestfallen) No. No. I can't have the police go  to the house. That won't work, there  are circumstances. (desperately) It's you... you've got to help me!  Please! I've gotta call home! I can't  wait. It could be too late! Janet!!  You've gotta help me! Please! You  can reconnect me. Please!! Don't  hang up! Don't hang up!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hurls the receiver at the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucker!! You heartless...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick doubles over, retching, clutching the side of the bo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "If you'd like to make a call, please  hang up and try again. If you need  help..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid is sprawled out over the bed, sleeping, Beth nestled  against him. She stirs and cuddles closer. Suddenly she realizes it's not Nick. She pulls away,  orientating herself. She quickly scoots out of bed and  hurriedly pulls on a pair of jeans. The alarm clock CLANGS. Beth looks about for the alarm. She tensely scatters some boxes. She dumps one, finds the alarm and shuts it off. S stares at the clock and drops it into a box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cheerfully) Morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth cringes slightly and turns to face Sid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (attempting a smile) Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning) Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't want to wake you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cheerfully) I'm awake. I'm a morning person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why don't you come back to bed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sitting up) Where do we start?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (firmly) No. (softening) You paint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks around the room littered with boxes and piles o clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll manage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cheerfully) Whatever you say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid gets out of bed, wrapping the sheet around himself. B stares at the room. She suddenly trembles. She steadies  herself on the bed table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth avoids his eyes, glancing around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (an outpouring) I'd be so much happier if I could  blame this on Nick, but it always  happens to me. I'm always left with  nothing. (taking a deep breath) It doesn't matter if I leave the guy  or if the guy leaves me -- I'm left  with nothing. I never do anything  for myself. I never acquire anything.  I mean Nick didn't take from me. He  stole a t.v. and left it for me. He  didn't take my things, he didn't  take our things... he didn't even  take his clothes! And I'll still  leave this house with nothing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He took three years from you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... (meeting his eyes) He didn't take 'em. I mean, when he  cared about me, he cared about me.  And he was really good in bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances away from Sid toward the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) I didn't expect more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns away from Sid and the bed. Sid moves toward her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (carefully) Beth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth summons up all the composure she can manage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to the  cluttered room) I can't face this. (looking to Sid) I'm gonna finish up the kitchen... (heading for the door) ...get some momentum...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes out the bedroom door. Sid stares after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick's sedan is parked in the same place as the night bef A YOUNG MAN with long hair ROARS into the rest stop on a  Harley-Davidson, his life's possession strapped on the ba He stops the bike between Nick's car and the phonebooth,  idling the engine, loudly. He looks to the phonebooth, th receiver dangling. He turns to Nick's sedan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phone work?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Awakened by the ROAR, Nick has wearily leaned his head ou the window. Nick stares at the young man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drained, Nick rests his head on the steering wheel. OFFSCREEN, the motorcycle starts up and zooms away. A sil falls over the rest stop. Without raising his head from the steering wheel, Nick st the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid is making the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gleefully  conspiratorially) How was he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sheepishly) He's twenty-four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid pulls up the blanket and fluffs the pillows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little weak on tenderness, but  long on juice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long on conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cupboards are all open and bare. A half dozen boxes a neatly stacked. Beth is sitting on the floor packing the  final dishes. Carol holds out a mug of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you need talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth stands and takes the coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I guess I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth sips her coffee, gazing out the kitchen window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The backyard. In the light of day it's lost its magical  quality. The grass needs cutting and is marred by brown  patches. The swingset looks pathetically rusted and  dilapidated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her face clouds over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cheerfully) So what are we doing?

dialogues.speaker: BETH AND CAROL
dialogues.text: Carol is staring at Beth staring out at the backyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to Carol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (w/ an edge of  desperation) I gotta get out here. I was in Tucson  two years before you and Nick got  here. (in disbelief) I've been here five years...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This state's driving me crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got no money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chagrined by self- awareness) I can't take it. I mean you're being  great, but I can't take it. I'm gonna  be gone, we won't see each other,  and I won't send the money. I won't.  I know... I won't get around, I'll  forget, I won't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks around the room in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (agitated) Shit. I'll sell all this shit. I  don't want any of it, just my car  and my clothes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (carefully) Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking her head) I'm sorry... I shouldn't have fucked  this kid last night. I should have  slept. Now I've got all this stuff  to do, and I'm tired, I'm churned  up, I'm in a fuckin' mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's do things, get you busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get all the stuff you wanna sell,  and I'll make some tag sale signs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one'll buy my stuff. It's all  junk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what people buy at tag sales.  Broken appliances, ugly knicknacks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth looks at the semi-packed boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) I guess I do have stuff to sell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boxes full of a motley collection of knickknacks, housewa and crummy appliances are spread out on the lawn. In the BACKGROUND a couple of M.T.V. influenced teens are checking out the knickknacks and goofing on them. MRS. DOTSON, a woman in her late forties wearing a NURSE' UNIFORM is poking through the odds and ends. Beth and Carol hovering near her. Mrs. Dotson picks up the coffee maker, examines it, and p it down. She picks up the blender, examines it, and puts down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatiently) Is there something specific you're  looking for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. (sheepishly) Actually everything... I don't have  anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just moved to town. (hesitating then  confiding) My husband passed away, and I, umm,  didn't want to have our things...  they were too familiar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth realizes why she's selling all her stuff -- it's too familiar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (abruptly) You can have it all for three hundred.  The stuff in these boxes and  everything inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taken aback) Oh, my, I don't know... everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything. (hesitating) Except the t.v.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Dotson searches Beth's face with a kind gaze. Beth s nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (apologetically) The t.v.s not for sale.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. NICK'S SEDAN
dialogues.text: Nick's smoking, looking haggard. Between drags, he anxiou taps a tempo on the steering wheel with his cigarette hol hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The highway and the desert stretch out before him, the he waves of late afternoon shimmering above the blacktop. In the distance, the giant teepee souvenir shop rises out the horizon like a mirage.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: An idea strikes him and his lips tighten into a small  determined smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of vacationing families and a busload of elderly sightseers poke through the stunning assortment of Native American souvenirs. Nick stands at the counter talking to a plump elderly NAV WOMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe some nice turquoise jewelry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) I don't think she really wears  jewelry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little boy stares at the disheveled Nick. His mother hu him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe a nice Navajo rug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) As a present? No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points past her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge beautifully feathered ceremonial headdress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would make her laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not amused) That's authentic -- it's very  expensive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got something like it but fake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth and Mrs. Dotson are standing beside the now empty  blankets. In the BACKGROUND, Sid and Carol are packing boxes into M Dotson's car. Mrs. Dotson has begun to fill out a check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, what's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you just leave the name blank? I  won't have an account, so I'll have  to find someplace to cash it for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Dotson looks at her. They stare into each other's ey

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Dotson hands Beth the check. Beth sticks it in her b pocket. After an awkward moment she extends her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Dotson takes her hand. Sid and Carol walk up to them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cheerfully) You're set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Dotson lets go of Beth's hand. They turn to Sid and  Carol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (warmly chagrined) You did all the work...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (good-naturedly) Sure. (mischieviously) Now I've gotta finish painting, but  Carol here would be happy to help  you unload.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol starts to protest and then checks herself for Beth' sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trapped, dryly) Of course. I'll follow you in my  car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mrs. Dotson) And I'll be by tomorrow with my truck  and the big things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads into the house. Beth stares after him. Mrs. Dots touches her shoulder, lightly, getting her attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Beth) Thank you. (smiling) You've given me a home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks to Carol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nicely) I'll be right along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Dotson walks off toward her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Beth) This had to be history's most  efficient tag sale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth laughs, distractedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... I'm sorry Sid stuck you with  unloading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem. (smiling to herself) He kinda bites my butt, but he's  okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth suddenly embraces Carol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen. (breaking the embrace) I'll probably be gone before you get  back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought maybe we could be roomies  for a while. You know, while you  figure out what's next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking her head) I can't. (after a beat,  admitting her feelings) He gets to me... too much. If I don't  go I'll end up with staying with  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently) You've done worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other and start to laugh. Their laughte builds -- a release of the strain of the last two days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick's driving fast, completely focused on the road ahead the wind ROARING through the open windows. A cheap plastic Indian headdress with brightly colored  synthetic feathers is perched on his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid's finished painting -- the room gleams. He pulls a  dropcloth off the bureau, then another one off of Beth's packed suitcases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Sid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid turns and looks, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth is standing in the doorway, a weariness having settl over her. She steps into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about selling the sofa  bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't really need one. When my  friends get drunk, they throw up and  sleep on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I gave it to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his arms around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gave me a lot more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (holding him tightly) It was all even in this department.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) ...Feel me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) I know... You're hard again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding her tightly, Sid runs his fingers down her spine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (torn) Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses him. They kiss, long and hard. Abruptly, she b the embrace and moves away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ironically self-aware) I just fleeced a widow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (protesting) No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was all junk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shivers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. I've got to get some aspirin... (shaking her head) I didn't drink enough to be hung  over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks away from Sid, out of the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth gulps down aspirin. She stares at herself in the mir wearily searching.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE MIRROR
dialogues.text: Sid appears in the doorway, his reflection small next to reflection of her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just feel bad for her like I  feel bad for her... 'cause her husband  died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doubting this) Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's about the saddest thing there  is... losing someone you love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth is struck by a certainty that she's never lost anyon she's loved because she's never really loved anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's never happened to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid hesitates, then speaks his heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you died, I couldn't stand life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps forward and kisses him. She steps back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (businesslike) I've got to go now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks out of the bathroom. Sid and THE CAMERA FOLLOW she hurries though the living room toward the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The new people'll be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She disappears down the hall to the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (following) Go to my house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Beth picks up her suitcases. Sid steps into the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While you find a place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I gotta get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She heads to the bedroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can talk to the realtors, I know  they've got a place in Agawam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking her head) No... Agawam?... no. I don't know  where I'm going. Somewhere else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks past him into the hallway. Sid and THE CAMERA  FOLLOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can call me when you get there.  I'll give you my number.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: She stops and puts down the suitcases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently) Sid. I'm going away. You're making  me way too important. You met me  yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And today I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps back, shaking her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus... one day...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't matter. You know that.  It can take a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth loses control, upset with herself for having mixed  emotions, upset with her life, and upset he's making this more difficult.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! That's... that's a fuckin' animal  thing, I've done that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I meet men, go home with them and  just stay. No decision involved --  it's just what I do. And then I don't  have to live my life, I just lead  theirs. I can't keep doing that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (adamant) We're not that way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What way are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're passionate. We're comfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been passionate, it's been  comfortable. But it hasn't been...  important. (after a beat) Like you're making it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (urgently) It is important! You know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! It was a night! It wasn't real.  It was fun, it was some great fucking!  But it's just something that happened!  It's not real!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It didn't "just happen"! You know  we're it! I'm the one for you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "one"?! I've had lots of "ones"!  I look like a baby but I'm twenty- fuckin'-- eight years old! You're  just the latest!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm the last. You've found me.  And it can go on forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! (her heart breaking  for him) Oh, Sid... Forever? (shaking her head) You have to understand -- it's just  talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defiantly disbelieving) It is. C'mon, these things you say...  c'mon! What?! If I died you couldn't  stand life? That's... that's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth can't bear the risk of opening her soul to believe h and she can't bear to hear the outpouring of his soul wit believing him. So she ends it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat, harshly) You won't know when I die. You won't  be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks up her suitcases and heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (following her, certain) You'd want me there. If I wasn't  there it wouldn't matter who was.  You'd be alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs her arms and spins her to face him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (imploring) Beth... Beth... you love me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defiantly) No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you feel? Think! You love me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at him, breathing deeply, gathering herself. H lets go of her arms and steps back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (her words carefully  chosen) I care about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to be with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (pause) I care about you. But I'm an adult.  I can say no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (w/ controlled anger) That's what makes you an adult?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unwavering) Yes. (pause) I can say no. (pause) No, I won't do that. No, I won't  have that. No, I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (needing to hear her  say it) You can say no to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks away from her. She stares at his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Have someplace to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (simply) I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Don't tell me what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes out the door. Sid goes to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth makes her way to her car. Sid stands in the doorway, watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and faces him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth tosses her suitcases in the backseat. She gets into car and starts the engine. Sid stands, willing her to stop the car. Beth pulls out to the end of the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up at the rearview mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid is framed in the doorway of her old home, waiting,  trusting that she can't leave, that they are destined.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Her eyes well with tears. Her face sets with resolve.

dialogues.speaker: THE HOUSE AND DRIVEWAY
dialogues.text: The car pulls out and disappears down the road. Sid stand in the doorway for a long moment. He steps back into the  house and shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick is driving, the cheap headdress still perched on his head. Crumpled empty coffee cups are scattered about the  front seat. He reaches up and turns the rearview mirror.

dialogues.speaker: REARVIEW MIRROR
dialogues.text: Nick's face stares back at him. It's not a pretty sight.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Nick reaches into the back seat, fishes and comes up with his necktie. He slips the still-knotted necktie over his  headdress and tightens it around his neck. Nick looks back to the road and suddenly swerves off an e ramp. The CAMERA LINGERS on the Exit Sign -- "Enfield AZ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid silently goes through the motions of pulling the mask tape from around the window sills of the freshly painted  room, his face a stony mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick's car screeches to a stop in front of the house. He  leaps out of the car and runs toward the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door flings open. Nick charges into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Beth! (bellowing) Beth!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid steps through the swinging door into the living room. Nick freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coldly) She's not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperately) Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! (a moment of manners) Excuse me. (exploding) Shiiiiit!! (confrontationally) Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coldly) The painter. You're Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Indian chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Nick, remembering the headdress, rips it off his hea and furiously tears it apart -- scattering a flurry of pl feathers. He hurls what's left of it across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (accusingly) You're too late. She's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angrily) I got that. Where'd she go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bitterly) She didn't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick runs out the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick runs out into his lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (running; under his  breath) Be at Carol's... be at Carol's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA FOLLOWING he races up to Carol's front door an leans on the doorbell -- a loud tight buzzing. He pounds on the door, then stops, gasping for breath. No one's home. He turns, leaning against the door for suppor staring out at tract house neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spent) I'm too late...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly he bolts for his car. Nick yanks his car door open and disappears into it. In a second he emerges with the bottle of scotch. It's empty. He eyes it for a moment then hurls it as far he can down the street -- it shatters explosively. He races to his front door and stops dead in his tracks a the open doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid has covered the floor and remaining furniture with dr cloths and is applying even strokes to the ceiling with a long handled roller. Nick steps in and stares at Sid and his own nearly empty  drop-cloth covered home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at the top of his  lungs) This really bothers me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a moment, with  mock politeness) Will you do me a favor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spitting out the  word) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Act normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick advances on Sid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (adamantly) Listen! I don't want to be normal. I  don't have to be, I don't! This is  my house. You're in my house. And  I'm tired of going to my house and  finding strangers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're face to face in a stand-off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not your house. You're gone.  I'm painting --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts the long handled roller right in Nick's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- for the new people -- whose house  it's going to be. (pause) You're gone. They're not here yet.  I'm here. (calmly) I guess that makes this my house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick ponders this logic, Sid's size, and the roller in hi face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (politely) May I look around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (w/ a stony politeness) Sure. Make yourself at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick wanders around the nearly empty room, then, after a  beat... ...he pulls a dropcloth off an object in the corner, reve the television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dismayed) Nooo... she left the television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointedly) She didn't seem to want it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's foolish. That t.v. is a  remarkable thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both stare at the television. The sweep of HEADLIGHTS turning into the driveway cross t faces. They both race to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol gets out of her car. Nick hurries toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flatly) You came back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little chagrined) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Beth here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Do you know where she went?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the doorway) She's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Carol, exasperated) Who is this guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walking past him  toward the house) Beth's new boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exploding) What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopping) You heard me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sid) Is this true?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and walks back into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Carol) Not really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He races after Sid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid is painting the ceiling. Nick bursts through the door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sid) Not really?! What? (w/ "say it ain't so"  attitude) Did you fuck her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus! The next day! (bitterly disillusioned) That's the world, huh? They don't  even wait a day anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stepping in the  doorway) You left her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensively) I didn't fuck anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (witheringly) You didn't find anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hurt) No... I didn't leave her for another  person, I left her for another place. (pause) Which I think is a little more  excusable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it's none of your fuckin'  business!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (threateningly) I think it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause you fucked her? No! That gives  you no business in my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you hadn't gone, I'd be done by  now. I'd be home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be glad you have a home, asshole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let it drop, Nick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (outraged) Why?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was nice to Beth when you treated  her like shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick stares at her -- knowing what she says is true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (protesting weakly) I came back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (busting him) Nick. This is me. You didn't come  back for Beth's sake -- something  just didn't work out like you had  planned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensively) You see -- you don't know everything  about me -- I didn't really have any  real plans!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was sweet to her. They were sweet  with each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth looked young with him. They had  a real connection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat, dryly) And I brought them together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He exhales loudly and holds his head in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems I'm blessed... in what I  do. I do wrong, and it turns out  right... that I've done right. So it  really doesn't matter what I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid ignores him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) I said "hey!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flamboyantly sarcastic) I hope you're very happy together!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glancing to Carol,  pointedly) She is, isn't she? (to Sid) If you two were such the happy couple  why the fuck did she leave, Romeo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After three years with you, she wanted  to be alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was already gone! This is not about  me and Beth, there is no me and Beth!  This is about you! Why didn't you go  with her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't offered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (advancing on him) People aren't going to offer you  anything! You have to take what you  want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't take another person. They  have to give themselves to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in his face) That's very wise, but not very true. (relentlessly) I sell televisions. People don't  know what they want. You have to  show them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't show her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go after her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave him alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He's not alone, he's with us.  She's alone. She's out there alone. (after a beat, quietly) Just hoping she's closer to what she  wants...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sardonically) And what is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exploding) I don't know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick throws his arms in the air and storms up to Carol's  face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would I know?! What do I know?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol doesn't flinch. He steps back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (w/ a sweeping gesture) I know that what I want isn't there. (pointing to his chest) It isn't here. (gesturing wildly) It isn't inside! It isn't outside! (spent) It doesn't exist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns on Sid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (forcefully) But you want her, and you aren't  doing shit about it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There isn't anything he can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can go after her. (to Sid) Go after her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't. She... (torn) My life is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of man won't fuck up his  life for the women he loves? Go find  her!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at Sid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wouldn't know where to look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groping) She'd she'd she'd... (triumphant) She'd head for her parents!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'd head for her parents. Believe  me. (pause, then flatly) They're in Florida. That's east.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick stares at Sid, waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (businesslike) You start driving east on route forty.  Keep going east and around eleven  start checking every roadside motel.  The budget ones... You do that all  night, you'll find her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know she's on the highway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you don't know where you're  going, you drive on the highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid looks to Carol, then around the drop cloth covered ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cheerfully) I'll finish painting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Carol) Do I have a chance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Sid both look to Carol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat, shaking  her head) You've got a chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (determined) Then I'm gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid races out the door. Nick tosses a self-satisfied smile at Carol and walks pas her to the door.

dialogues.speaker: SOUND
dialogues.text: Sid's truck engine roars to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid peels out, driving up onto the lawn past Nick and Car cars, out onto the street and out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOORWAY
dialogues.text: Carol steps into the doorway beside Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. (dryly) Start painting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks back into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Fuck the ceiling. (walking in) Who looks up that often?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol follows him into the room. Nick slumps on the sofa, staring at the blank t.v.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (happily) This is it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN and a WOMAN, both slightly portly Mexican-Americans their late forties, wearing their Sunday best, step over threshold and kiss. The man is carrying the woman cradled in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (politely) Hello...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised, breaking  the kiss) Oh. Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four stare at each other in awkward silence, the woma still cradled in the man's arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. We thought it was going  to be empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flatly) It is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cheerfully) We're here to move in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man puts her down on her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you the couple moving out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Carol look to each other, at a loss. Nick looks  back to the couple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (improvising) We're your new neighbors. From next  door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol throws him a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. (putting on a good  face) It's nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds out his hand to shake. After an instant of awkwa hesitation they all shake hands with too much enthusiasm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cheerfully, while  shaking hands) It is... and it's so nice of you to  greet us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They finish the handshakes -- there's an awkward pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, we're here for the t.v.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He waits, half expecting this statement to be challenged. isn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confidently) The people who left here -- our old  neighbors -- left us that t.v.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all look at the t.v.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. It's very nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. It is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an awkward pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (going to the t.v.) Well, dear... we should carry it  home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Carol lift the t.v.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you need help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can manage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move toward the front door, Carol going backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks to make eye contact with Carol. He can't. She' looking back over her shoulder for obstacles. He smiles a glances toward the couple. Nick and Carol go out the door, lugging the t.v.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Nice meeting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man and woman look at each other. They look around th room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not done painting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll finish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares out the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whimsically) I wonder where our furniture is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks back to him. He's staring at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're lugging the t.v. across to Carol's -- Carol backi up and Nick going forward. They arrive at the front door. Nick takes most of the weight of the t.v., while Carol fu with her key into her front door lock with her free hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to be their new  neighbor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was just something to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol gets the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol backs into the house, leading the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lug the t.v. toward the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look terrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Well, I had a big day. (after a beat) I went to my parent's house. Like  you said to. And there was this  ancient man, this giant man in the  doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They step into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol leads them to a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I thought, "It's my father. My  how he's aged."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were drunk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They gingerly put the t.v. down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at the house. At the house I was  stone sober.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick slumps down onto the sofa. Carol watches him, puzzle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was very tall. He was too tall to  be my father. He was wearing a long  overcoat, and I thought, "it's a  trick, he's on my mother's shoulders".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles at the memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then out from behind him came  this beautiful young girl... Beth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lost in reverie) And they sang to me. They sang "London  Bridge is Falling Down"... (singing softly) "Falling down, falling down.".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks to Carol. She stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seriously) It was very touching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensively) It was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol sits beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you've been doing... you can't  do anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks to Carol, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just can't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat,  agreeably) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very skeptically) Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensively) I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (determined) It's not like you can't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interjecting) I'll stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (urgently) It's that I don't want you to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've stopped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at Nick. He avoids her stare. She takes his fa in her hand and makes him look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring in his eyes) Nick. (emphatic) I don't want you to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick stares in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly, after a beat) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lets go of his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. (after a beat, wryly) I hate talking to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the windshield we see Sid driving slowly, looking out at motel parking lots. Their neon signs reflect in th windshield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gas stations, fast food joints and motels. Sid and his truck pull away from the strip and up onto th on ramp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid and his truck pull onto the highway.

dialogues.speaker: CREDITS ROLL
dialogues.text: As Sid's taillights disappear down the barren highway.
